authors.author: W. George Cooper Warren D. Cornell

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: Peace, Peace, wonderful peace, newline Coming down from the Father above. newline Sweep over my spirit forever, I pray, newline In fathomless billows of love.

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: Far away in the depths newline Of my spirit tonight newline Rolls a melody sweeter than psalm; newline In celestial-like strains newline It unceasingly falls newline O'er my soul like an infinite calm.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: What a treasure I have newline In this wonderful peace, newline Buried deep in the heart of my soul, newline So secure that no power can mine it away newline While the years of eternity roll.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: I am resting tonight newline In this wonderful peace, newline Resting sweetly in Jesus' control. newline For I'm kept from all danger newline By night and by day, newline And His glory is flooding my soul.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: And me-thinks when I rise newline To that city of peace, newline Where the Author of peace I shall see, newline That one strain of the song newline Which the ransomed will sing newline In that heavenly kingdom shall be:

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: Ah soul, are you here newline Without comfort or rest, newline Marching down the rough pathway of time? newline Make Jesus your friend newline Ere the shadows grow dark. newline Oh accept this sweet peace so sublime.
